ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ gie ɔ̀ nyé ńgwɔ́ múɔshùm, ɔ̀ kímte nyìŋ gẅie à la pwóon gú. Kímte yé tá melyɛʼɛ́ láʼ me tepòŋ e láʼ ńgwaa tó, á fʉ̀ʼ gie ɔ̀ ge gÿo gɔɔn ngie: «Legíŋ ńnéŋe ndùm njÿó, à te ne ḿboŋo wɔ́ɔn mɔ́.»
en: So remember your Creator in the days of your youth:

ngiemboon: Á ge láʼ gwɔ́ fʉʼó, nèm pɔ́ kyɛ̀ʼ sele ésíŋ,
en: before the sun and the light are darkened,

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ lyɛʼó ŋwɛ́, papyɛ́b ndá e vɛ,
en: on the day when the guardians of the house tremble,

ngiemboon: Áa fʉ̀ʼ gie ncwò ndá gẅie é kẅɛɛ lǎŋ ge gwaa jÿɔ́ʼɔ,
en: the doors at the street are shut

ngiemboon: Áa fʉ̀ʼ gie nyìŋ líe mánzsè lekwɔʼɔ́, ḿvɛ,
en: Also, they are afraid of heights and dangers on the road;

ngiemboon: Nkÿo gẅie mé lɔgɔ tʉ̌ nkáb ńnyɛte ge gÿo záʼa,
en: before the silver cord is snapped,

ngiemboon: Atsetsáʼ piŋe na tsetsáʼ, á jʉʼ gie á la fó wó,
en: and the dust returns to the earth as it once was,

ngiemboon: Anzsènò gɔɔn ngie: akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ gwɔ́ pɔ́ fÿɔ́g sẅɛ̀ɛ, akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ lémte ńgʉa pɔ́ páʼ ndyé mmɔ̌g.
en: “Absolute futility,” says the Teacher. “Everything is futile.”

ngiemboon: Anzsènò la te gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndàʼ nzsènò wɔ́, à la gíŋ ńzíʼi mmó gie à zsě, á mbwó pʉ̀a, pɔ́ lɔg ńgẅiin zsénò. À la tsẅíʼte mesaglegʉa, ńtsaʼ tà ńkúu letsiŋé, ésiŋte ḿbiŋ ńná shÿó wembòŋo, á na mesaglegʉa ŋwɛ́.
en: In addition to the Teacher being a wise man, he constantly taught the people knowledge; he weighed, explored, and arranged many proverbs.

ngiemboon: Nzsènò la kag tʉ̀ légẅiin meshwóŋè mie é póŋo lézẅíʼte, à la kwàʼ ńŋweʼe mmó gie áa nénʉ́.
en: The Teacher sought to find delightful sayings and write words of truth accurately.

ngiemboon: Meshwóŋè ngàŋa zsénò ée páʼ metÿǒ mie ésẅíte mé lɔg ńtsóte menɔ̀ɔn pɔ́ giŋ, epʉ̀a pie é ŋweʼe meŋwàʼne, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ metÿǒ ntẅiʼ mie mé nÿɔgɔ ssé kwàʼ mboŋó, e Ssé gie yé zɔɔ ndàʼ ngàŋa pyɛ́bɛ zɔ ké ńnáa kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ.
en: The sayings of the wise are like cattle prods,   and those from masters of collections are like firmly embedded nails.  # 12:11 Ezr 9:8; Is 22:23 The sayings are given by one Shepherd.  # 12:11 Or by a shepherd

ngiemboon: Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn wembàŋa, pɔ́ɔn légʉa na mmó gie n ziʼí gú, ńkẅiʼi tsɔ́, leŋweʼe meŋwàʼne, áa fàʼ gie á téen ńdáʼa ḿmaga wɔ́, lepiŋ ńzíʼi mmó tɛʼ, á gÿo nyìŋ kʉ́a kʉ̌a.
en: But beyond these, my son, be warned: there is no end to the making of many books,   and much study wearies the body.  # 12:12 Ec 1:18

ngiemboon: Ammó gie n ge lɔg pú kwɛ́ metwó na menò mie mé gɔ̌ɔn, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie: pɔ́g Ssé, ńkúʼte membʉ̌ mé, áa mmó gie á zɛ́te mbwó mânyìŋ ntsèm.
en: When all has been heard, the conclusion of the matter is this: fear God   and keep his commands, because this is for all  # 12:13 Or is the whole duty of humanity.  # 12:13 Ps 97:5; Ac 4:12; Rm 10:12

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ngie é Ssé ge gÿo tsɔ́ʼte ntsaŋ ye wɛ̌ wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ, á na kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ gie à la gÿo, tà mbɔɔ gie à la gÿo tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm, á yembòŋo kà yetepòŋ wɔ́ɔ.
en: For God will bring every act to judgment,   including every hidden thing, whether good or evil.
